The Asian section of the **[2018 FIFA World Cup
qualification](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification "2018 FIFA World Cup
qualification")** acted as qualifiers for the [2018 FIFA World
Cup](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup"), held in Russia, for
national teams which are members of the [Asian Football
Confederation](/wiki/Asian_Football_Confederation "Asian Football
Confederation") (AFC). 4.5 slots (4 direct slots and 1 inter-confederation
play-off slot) in the final tournament were available for AFC teams.[1]

On 16 April 2014, the AFC Executive Committee approved a proposal to merge the
preliminary qualification rounds of the FIFA World Cup and the [AFC Asian
Cup](/wiki/AFC_Asian_Cup "AFC Asian Cup"), which will be expanded to 24 teams
starting in [2019](/wiki/2019_AFC_Asian_Cup "2019 AFC Asian Cup").[2]
Therefore, the first two rounds of the FIFA World Cup qualifiers also acted as
[qualifiers](/wiki/2019_AFC_Asian_Cup_qualification "2019 AFC Asian Cup
qualification") for the [2019 AFC Asian Cup](/wiki/2019_AFC_Asian_Cup "2019
AFC Asian Cup") in the [United Arab Emirates](/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates
"United Arab Emirates").

##
Format[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Format")]

The qualification structure was as follows:[2][3]

  * **First round** : 12 teams (ranked 35–46) played home-and-away over [two legs](/wiki/Two-legged_tie "Two-legged tie"). The six winners advanced to the second round.
  * **Second round** : 40 teams (ranked 1–34 and six first round winners) were divided into eight groups of five teams to play home-and-away [round-robin](/wiki/Round-robin_tournament "Round-robin tournament") matches. The eight group winners and the four best group runners-up advanced to the third round of FIFA World Cup qualification as well as qualifying for the [2019 AFC Asian Cup](/wiki/2019_AFC_Asian_Cup "2019 AFC Asian Cup") finals.
  * **Third round** : The 12 teams (an increase from 10 for [2014](/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\) "2014 FIFA World Cup qualification \(AFC\)")) which had advanced from the second round were divided into two groups of six teams to play home-and-away round-robin matches. The top two teams of each group qualified for the [2018 FIFA World Cup](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup "2018 FIFA World Cup"), and the two third-placed teams advanced to the fourth round.
  * **Fourth round** : The two third-placed teams of each group from the third round played home-and-away over two legs. The winners advanced to the [inter-confederation play-offs](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(inter-confederation_play-offs\) "2018 FIFA World Cup qualification \(inter-confederation play-offs\)").

##
Entrants[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Entrants")]

The 46 FIFA-affiliated nations from the AFC entered qualification.[4] In order
to determine which nations would compete in the first round and which nations
would receive a bye through to the second round, the [FIFA World
Rankings](/wiki/FIFA_World_Rankings "FIFA World Rankings") of January 2015
were used (shown in parentheses), as those were the latest published rankings
prior to the first round draw. The FIFA Rankings of January 2015 were also
used for seeding of the first round draw; however, for seeding in the second
round and third round draws, the most recent FIFA Rankings prior to those
draws were used.

###
Groups[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Groups")]

show[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification
tiebreakers](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification#Tiebreakers "2018 FIFA
World Cup qualification")  
---  
In league format, the ranking of teams in each group is based on the following
criteria (regulations Articles 20.6 and 20.7):[13]

  1. [Points](/wiki/Three_points_for_a_win "Three points for a win") (3 points for a win, 1 point for a draw, 0 points for a loss)
  2. Overall [goal difference](/wiki/Goal_difference "Goal difference")
  3. Overall goals scored
  4. Points in matches between tied teams
  5. Goal difference in matches between tied teams
  6. Goals scored in matches between tied teams
  7. [Away goals](/wiki/Away_goals_rule "Away goals rule") scored in matches between tied teams (if the tie is only between two teams in home-and-away league format)
  8. Fair play points 
     * first yellow card: minus 1 point
     * indirect red card (second yellow card): minus 3 points
     * direct red card: minus 4 points
     * yellow card and direct red card: minus 5 points
  9. Drawing of lots by the FIFA Organising Committee

### Ranking of runner-up
teams[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=16
"Edit section: Ranking of runner-up teams")]

To determine the four best runner-up teams, the following criteria were used:

  1. [Points](/wiki/Points_\(association_football\) "Points \(association football\)") (3 points for a win, 1 point for a draw, 0 points for a loss)
  2. [Goal difference](/wiki/Goal_difference "Goal difference")
  3. Goals scored
  4. Fair play points
  5. Drawing of lots

As a result of Indonesia being disqualified due to FIFA suspension, Group F
contained only four teams compared to five teams in all other groups.
Therefore, the results against the fifth-placed team were not counted when
determining the ranking of the runner-up teams.[21]

## Third
round[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=17
"Edit section: Third round")]

Main article: [2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – AFC Third
Round](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_AFC_Third_Round "2018
FIFA World Cup qualification – AFC Third Round")

The third round consisted of two groups of six teams. The first two teams in
each group qualified for the 2018 FIFA World Cup. The two third-placed teams
proceeded to the fourth round.

The draw for the third round was held on 12 April 2016, at 16:30
[MST](/wiki/Time_in_Malaysia "Time in Malaysia") ([UTC+8](/wiki/UTC%2B08:00
"UTC+08:00")), at the [Mandarin Oriental
Hotel](/wiki/Mandarin_Oriental_Hotel_Group#Kuala_Lumpur "Mandarin Oriental
Hotel Group") in [Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur "Kuala Lumpur"),
[Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia "Malaysia").[22][23]

###
Groups[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=18
"Edit section: Groups")]

show[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification
tiebreakers](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification#Tiebreakers "2018 FIFA
World Cup qualification")  
---  
In league format, the ranking of teams in each group is based on the following
criteria (regulations Articles 20.6 and 20.7):[13]

  1. [Points](/wiki/Three_points_for_a_win "Three points for a win") (3 points for a win, 1 point for a draw, 0 points for a loss)
  2. Overall [goal difference](/wiki/Goal_difference "Goal difference")
  3. Overall goals scored
  4. Points in matches between tied teams
  5. Goal difference in matches between tied teams
  6. Goals scored in matches between tied teams
  7. [Away goals](/wiki/Away_goals_rule "Away goals rule") scored in matches between tied teams (if the tie is only between two teams in home-and-away league format)
  8. Fair play points 
     * first yellow card: minus 1 point
     * indirect red card (second yellow card): minus 3 points
     * direct red card: minus 4 points
     * yellow card and direct red card: minus 5 points
  9. Drawing of lots by the FIFA Organising Committee

## Fourth
round[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=21
"Edit section: Fourth round")]

Main article: [2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – AFC Fourth
Round](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_AFC_Fourth_Round
"2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – AFC Fourth Round")

The two third-placed teams in each group from the third round played against
each other home-and-away over two legs to determine which team advanced to the
[inter-confederation play-
offs](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(inter-confederation_play-
offs\) "2018 FIFA World Cup qualification \(inter-confederation play-offs\)").

The order of legs was announced during the draw for the third round.[24] Syria
played their home match, as with all their home matches in the third round, in
Malaysia due to the war time condition in Syria.[25]

Team 1  | [Agg.](/wiki/Aggregate_score "Aggregate score") | Team 2  | 1st leg  | 2nd leg   
---|---|---|---|---

## Inter-confederation play-
offs[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(AFC\)&action=edit&section=22
"Edit section: Inter-confederation play-offs")]

Main article: [2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONCACAF–AFC play-
off)](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_\(CONCACAF%E2%80%93AFC_play-
off\) "2018 FIFA World Cup qualification \(CONCACAF–AFC play-off\)")

The draw for the inter-confederation play-offs was held as part of the 2018
FIFA World Cup Preliminary Draw on 25 July 2015, starting 18:00
[MSK](/wiki/Moscow_Standard_Time "Moscow Standard Time")
([UTC+3](/wiki/UTC%2B03:00 "UTC+03:00")), at the Konstantinovsky Palace in
[Strelna](/wiki/Strelna "Strelna"), [Saint Petersburg](/wiki/Saint_Petersburg
"Saint Petersburg").[26] The fifth-placed team from AFC was drawn against the
fourth-placed team from CONCACAF, with the AFC team hosting the second
leg.[27]
